title: Domain Pattern – How the Domain Influences the Architecture
speaker: Carola Lilienthal

timeline.description_de: Motivation: Altsysteme, die teuer und schwer zu erweitern sind (Big Ball of Mud)
timeline.description_en: Motivation: Legacy systems that are expensive and hard to extend (Big Ball of Mud)

timeline.description_de: Step 2: Aufteilung der Domäne in Teile einer Zielarchitektur
timeline.description_en: Step 2: Splitting the domain into parts of a target architecture

timeline.description_de: Step 3: Vergleich der Ist- und Zielarchitektur
timeline.description_en: Step 3: Comparing the current and target architecture

timeline.description_de: Wie können die Architekturen verglichen bzw. bewertet werden?
timeline.description_en: How can architectures be compared or evaluated?

timeline.description_de: Wo fange ich mit der Transformation bei einem Big Ball of Mud an?
timeline.description_en: Where do I start transforming a Big Ball of Mud?

timeline.description_de: Was sind die Schritte zur Transformation eines technisch geschichteten Systems
timeline.description_en: What are the steps for transforming a technically layered system?

timeline.description_de: Transformation eines technisch geschichteten Systems in Modulen
timeline.description_en: Transforming a technically layered system into modules

timeline.description_de: Domänenmuster: Pipeline Domäne, Blackboard Domäne und Dialogdomäne
timeline.description_en: Domain patterns: Pipeline domain, Blackboard domain, and Dialog domain

timeline.description_de: Beispiel: Planung von Untergrundarbeiten in Hamburg - Von der Blackboard-Domäne zur Diskussions-Domäne
timeline.description_en: Example: Planning underground work in Hamburg – From the Blackboard domain to the Discussion domain

timeline.description_de: Zusammenfassung und Übergang zu Fragen und Antworten

quotes.text: A really good architecture [...] would have modules [...] with a nice layering and with very little coupling in between.
quotes.author: Carola Lilienthal

quotes.text: Whenever you touch a part of your software, write a test for that.
quotes.author: Carola Lilienthal

quotes.text: Sometimes it's easy to cut a domain into pieces and sometimes it's really hard. [...] we tried to find some abstractions [...] and we called it domain patterns.
quotes.author: Carola Lilienthal

quotes.text: You will not have a huge domain that has only one domain pattern.
quotes.author: Carola Lilienthal

quotes.text: Domains [...] change, because there is all of a sudden software.
quotes.author: Carola Lilienthal

quotes.text: Their software system moved and the domain moved and they both interacted with each other to change the world.
quotes.author: Carola Lilienthal
